title: Police blame mayor for Sirajganj journalist Shimul's death
text:
Police blame mayor for Sirajganj journalist Shimul's death Sirajganj Correspondent, bdnews24.com Journalist Abdul Hakim Shimul died when hit by bullet fired by Sirajganj's Shahzadpur Municipality Mayor Halimul Haque Miru, police said. Related Stories 
'Mayor' fired the fatal shot 
On Thursday, there was a violent clash between supporters of sacked Shahzadpur Awami League president Abdur Rahim (VP Rahim) and those of the party unit's Organising Secretary and Mayor Miru. 
Bangla national daily Samakal's local correspondent Shimul was hit on his head by a bullet while covering the clash. 
That led to his death on Friday while he was being transferred for better treatment to Dhaka from Bogra. 
Police said they acted promptly after the clash erupted. 
"I was there on the spot. The mayor opened fire ignoring my repeated requests. Only the mayor fired, no one else did. He fired several times," said Additional Superintendent of Police Abul Hasnat. 
His statement came on Saturday before Shimul's funeral prayer at the Shahzadpur Pilot High School grounds. "It's an unfortunate incident, which took place in front of us. We will bring the culprit to justice." 
The senior police officer said they have seized 43 rounds of ammunition from the mayor's house and six empty cartridges from the spot. 
A manhunt is on for Mayor Miru and he can be arrested soon, said Hasnat. 
Local MP Hasibur Rahman Swapan, Upazila administration chief (UNO) Mamun Al Rajib, Upazila Council Chairman and Shahzadpur Awami League General Secretary Azad Rahman also attended the funeral prayers. 
"Shahzadpur residents are well aware of the gun-toting mayor and his brothers. A journalist has died when hit by bullets fired by him (mayor). It's a shameful incident," said Awami League lawmaker Swapan. 
Mayor Miru, however, claimed after Thursday's clash that he had fired only once in the air. Tension has gripped through the Shahzadpur town since the incident. A six-hour general strike has been observed on Saturday.
Shimul's family has started a police case against 18 persons, including Mayor Miru. 
The investigating officer, Sub-Inspector Kamal Debnath said they have detained three persons so far. 
They are the mayor's brothers, Hafizul Haque Pintu and Habibul Haque Mintu, and local Awami League leader KM Nasuruddin. 
The mayor's shotgun has been seized already, said Shahzadpur police OC Rezaul.
